be6686da-9e05-40bb-9b0b-71decbce1ecf.description: Earners of the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) designation demonstrate an understanding of the full spectrum of employee benefits, from health care and retirement plan strategies to legal and regulatory compliance—elevating their role in employee engagement and organizational success. CEBS is offered by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans, with curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor, the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
be6686da-9e05-40bb-9b0b-71decbce1ecf.name: Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS) U.S.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete each of the required CEBS courses through self-study or optional instructor-led classes and score a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

94aba363-e3e8-4c0f-b9bb-a9b756317388.description: Earners of the Group Benefits Associate (GBA) designation demonstrate an understanding of group and health benefits. With curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor, the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, designees are prepared to effectively design, administer, and communicate group benefits. The GBA is part of the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS) credential, offered by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans.
94aba363-e3e8-4c0f-b9bb-a9b756317388.name: Group Benefits Associate (GBA) U.S.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete each of the required Group Benefits Associate courses through self-study or optional instructor-led classes and score a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

0b3a9d79-8d21-4227-823f-a6353e3c8419.description: Earners of the Retirement Plans Associate (RPA) designation demonstrate an understanding of DC and DB retirement plans, and management of plan assets. With curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor, the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, designees are prepared to effectively design and manage retirement plans. The RPA is part of the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS) credential, offered by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans.
0b3a9d79-8d21-4227-823f-a6353e3c8419.name: Retirement Plans Associate (RPA) U.S.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete each of the required Retirement Plans Associate courses through self-study or optional instructor-led classes and score a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

ad743273-60e4-4205-a245-6ebb3b77cc25.description: CEBS® graduates who are CEBS-Compliant validate their ongoing commitment to the industry by continuing to learn the latest in employee benefits. They remain CEBS-Compliant by earning a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years. This sets them apart as committed, knowledgeable professionals dedicated to career-long learning. This status is beneficial for all CEBS designees from recent graduates to longtime designation holders at every level of their career.
ad743273-60e4-4205-a245-6ebb3b77cc25.name: CEBS®-Compliant U.S. 2024

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

4878913e-3f2c-423b-887a-5c6f678b7556.description: Earners of the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) designation demonstrate an understanding of the full spectrum of design, funding and administration of group health and retirement benefits—elevating their role in employee engagement and organizational success. CEBS is offered by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans, with curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor, Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia.
4878913e-3f2c-423b-887a-5c6f678b7556.name: Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS) Canada

badge_template_activities.title: Complete each of the required CEBS courses through self-study or optional instructor-led classes, and score a passing grade on the 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

31d546a1-53b2-4668-b0a3-14de0a2ba71f.description: CEBS® graduates who are CEBS-Compliant validate their ongoing commitment to the industry by continuing to learn the latest in employee benefits. They remain CEBS-Compliant by earning a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years. This sets them apart as committed, knowledgeable professionals dedicated to career-long learning. This status is beneficial for all CEBS designees from recent graduates to longtime designation holders at every level of their career.
31d546a1-53b2-4668-b0a3-14de0a2ba71f.name: CEBS®-Compliant U.S. 2023

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

4dfa4666-7185-4f9f-919f-8e849e24264f.description: Earners of the Group Benefits Associate (GBA) designation demonstrate an understanding of life, health and other group benefits. With curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, designees are prepared to effectively design, fund, administer, and communicate group benefits. The GBA is part of the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS) credential, offered by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans.
4dfa4666-7185-4f9f-919f-8e849e24264f.name: Group Benefits Associate (GBA) Canada

badge_template_activities.title: Complete each of the required Group Benefits Associate courses through self-study or optional instructor-led classes and score a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

e4afd5df-83c4-4a9c-bf99-b4c11f04fc36.description: Earners of the Retirement Plans Associate (RPA) designation demonstrate an understanding of pension plans, government-sponsored plans, and management of plan assets. With curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor, Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, designees are prepared to effectively design and manage retirement plans. The RPA is part of the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS) credential, offered by the International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans.
e4afd5df-83c4-4a9c-bf99-b4c11f04fc36.name: Retirement Plans Associate (RPA) Canada

badge_template_activities.title: Complete each of the required Retirement Plans Associate courses through self-study or optional instructor-led classes and score a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

e3e60ee7-d99f-4859-8167-b95a5a8336f7.description: CEBS® graduates who are CEBS-Compliant validate their ongoing commitment to the industry by continuing to learn the latest in employee benefits. They remain CEBS-Compliant by earning a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years. This sets them apart as committed, knowledgeable professionals dedicated to career-long learning. This status is beneficial for all CEBS designees from recent graduates to longtime designation holders at every level of their career.
e3e60ee7-d99f-4859-8167-b95a5a8336f7.name: CEBS®-Compliant Canada 2024

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

73a4331f-ebc3-41f4-b94c-8438ba6d3822.name: CEBS®-Compliant Canada 2023

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years.

efcdcea3-89bf-432c-86ac-d0037c424ba7.description: Earners of the Compensation Management Specialist (CMS) designation demonstrate an understanding of compensation and human resources, including executive compensation. With curriculum and exams developed by program co-sponsor, the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, designees are prepared to effectively design, administer, and communicate compensation plans.
efcdcea3-89bf-432c-86ac-d0037c424ba7.name: Compensation Management Specialist (CMS) U.S.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed each of the required Compensation Management Specialist courses and scored a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to the CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.

f36018f3-d5e6-4364-912c-2aad3e599f5b.description: Earners of the Compensation Management Specialist (CMS) designation demonstrate an understanding of compensation and human resources, including executive compensation. With curriculum and exams developed by the program co-sponsor, Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, designees are prepared to effectively design, administer, and communicate compensation plans.
f36018f3-d5e6-4364-912c-2aad3e599f5b.name: Compensation Management Specialist (CMS) Canada

badge_template_activities.title: Completed each of the required Compensation Management Specialist courses and scored a passing grade on a 100-question proctored exam for each course.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct .

f24b0d9b-2f03-48e2-9682-c5d6cf1c5d23.description: Current ISCEBS members who are also CEBS-Compliant validate their ongoing commitment to the industry by continuing to learn the latest in employee benefits. They recognize the value of a professional organizational membership and the career-enhancing potential and opportunity it brings. This sets them apart as committed, knowledgeable and dedicated professionals. This status is beneficial for all CEBS designees from recent graduates to longtime designation holders at every level of their career.
f24b0d9b-2f03-48e2-9682-c5d6cf1c5d23.name: ISCEBS Gold Member U.S. 2023

badge_template_activities.title: Current membership in the International Society of Certified Employee Benefit Specialists.
Earn the Certified Employee Benefit Specialist® (CEBS®) professional designation.
Complete and report a minimum of 30 hours of continuing education credit every two years.
Adhere to ISCEBS Principles of Conduct.
Adhere to CEBS Precertification Standards and Principles of Conduct.
